name: Ten-Item Personality Inventory
description: A very brief measure of the Big Five personality dimensions: Extraversion, Agreeableness, Conscientiousness, Emotional Stability, and Openness to Experience. Designed for situations where time is limited.
reference: Gosling, S. D., Rentfrow, P. J., & Swann, W. B., Jr. (2003). A very brief measure of the Big Five personality domains. Journal of Research in Personality, 37, 504-528.
instructions: Here are a number of personality traits that may or may not apply to you. Please indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each statement. You should rate the extent to which the pair of traits applies to you, even if one characteristic applies more strongly than the other.

questions.name: tipi_1
questions.description: I see myself as: Extraverted, enthusiastic

questions.name: tipi_2
questions.description: I see myself as: Critical, quarrelsome

questions.name: tipi_3
questions.description: I see myself as: Dependable, self-disciplined

questions.name: tipi_4
questions.description: I see myself as: Anxious, easily upset

questions.name: tipi_5
questions.description: I see myself as: Open to new experiences, complex

questions.name: tipi_6
questions.description: I see myself as: Reserved, quiet

questions.name: tipi_7
questions.description: I see myself as: Sympathetic, warm

questions.name: tipi_8
questions.description: I see myself as: Disorganized, careless

questions.name: tipi_9
questions.description: I see myself as: Calm, emotionally stable

questions.name: tipi_10
questions.description: I see myself as: Conventional, uncreative
